Been off the site for a while.  Don't really see any of the familar names from two years ago.  Anyway had my FET done yesterday at 11:00am.  I am on aspirin 81 mg, Heparin two shots a day, and progesterone once a nite.  We have a blood clotting disorder which we researched and found out all on our own.  Asked the doctor to run the test and he did against his better judgement but what do you know we were right!  All these years of heartache and miscarriages to find out aspirin and heparin will do the trick.  Anyway we put three embryos in.  One was a grade 1 the others were grade 2!  Feel fine today, just on bedrest and taking it real easy!  Had a miscarriage in 2006, failed IVF/FET in 2007, many rounds of clomid and femara, many IUIs.  Keeping my fingers crossed! And in deep prayer!  Many Blessings to all!

Thank you so much for the feedback and positive vibes.  I will remain hopeful.I'm new to this forum as a posting member but have been reading for a while.  All the experiences and feedback have been very helpful.As a point of reference for folks, I am 43yrs old and after 3 failed iui's we turned to IVF. I had to halt my first cycle in June because of poor response to my initial protocal (bcp, lupron 5U am's, 2 powders menopur pm, 300 gonal pms) didn't work well for me.  I only produced 2 follicles.  After they changed my protocol to (20U micro lupron am/pm, 4powders menopur pm, follistim 450 pm - which replaced gonal, Saizen .4 pm) I responded much better and they were able to retrieve 8 eggs.I wish everyone much luck with your individual ivf/iui experiences.

During my 2ww, I'm taking the progesterone (Endometrim) vaginal suppositories am/pm.  Each has 100mg so 200mg a day.  Aside from that I'm doing the estrogen (Estradiol Valerate) every 3rd day via a shot to the hip.  I usually have my sister do it for me since my husband is so squeamish.  I've been lucky in that she's been available on most of my shot days.  If I am a BFP I beleive you do this through week 10 or 12.

Hi ladies,I joined this site when in April when I was going through my first IVF cycle.  Sorry, I don't know all of the acronyms, so I just type it all out.I am 42, got re-married last April.My first round, in April, I was on Menopur, Brevelle....many meds, to use my own eggs and my husbands sperm.  They retrieved 12 eggs, did the PGD and gender selection for a girl, there were only 2 girls out of 4 decent eggs, but not good quality and of the 2 girls, there was only 1 that was sufficient to transfer.  We used the 1.  Got a BFN.  25k and out of my mind thinking that was my one and only try.I decided to tap into my 401k and go 1 round with an egg donor.  I am a bit miffed my Doc didn't tell me my odds of using my own eggs compared to using a young donor, but it is over, money is spent, gone, never coming back.So we started this new round in early July once we picked our egg donor and I share the eggs with another lady.  So we split the eggs that are retrieved.We go in tomorrow for my Husbands TESA (sperm aspiration) and I believe the donor is going in sometime tomorrow for the egg retrieval, then we do PGD, 5 day blast and Friday Aug 5th, I go in for transfer.  So I will know Monday how many eggs were fertilized, just won't know how many girls until the day I go in for the transfer.I am on Estrace 3x a day and a Vivelle patch every other day.  Start progesterone oil shotstomorrow.  I have gained 5 lbs with these meds, is anyone else on these.I am nervous.  Doc will only transfer 2 since the donor is 23 years old.  So this is my last chance.Best wishes to you all.

Congrats on your donor cycle! : )  I wish you much success.  We seem to learn alot along the fertility journey, it's definately the road of hard knocks!  It's bumpy and very curvy, but hopefully, in the end, we will all be successful!!!!I have 1 question.... what happens if they are all boys??? Im sure that won't happen, but I just wondering what would happen if it did???Twin girls would be awesome!  Please keep us updated on your journey! : )  Here's to a boatload of girls!!!!

Hi everyone.  I too will be on the IVF/FET journey with you.  This will be our third transfer.  1st IVF in Feb, 2nd in June, both unsuccessful.  This time we will be doing a FET on 8/15.  Transferring 1 blast.  This one has a better grading than our last (this one AA, last one AB), but our RE said our chances are lower since it is a frozen cycle.  I'm a bit bummed about that.

We went in this morning at 9am and it was the strangest thing.  The donor was in there and the other couple that is sharing the eggs with me.  We didn't see eachother, but knew we were all there.  I waited in the waiting room while my husband was have the aspiration done and I ended up talking to the donors best friend.  She told me what a wonderful person the donor is and what a great family she has.....So the question, if they are all boys?????? Well hopefully odds will allow some girls, BUT if they are all boys, we will go for having a beautiful baby boy.They are being fertilized right this moment as I type.  Tomorrow I will get the call of how many eggs were mine and then how many of them fertilized.  They will start the PGD and gender selection testing, which they send off to NY.  Then I will get scheduled for Fri. Aug 5th to go in for the transfer and they will first tell us how the quality of the eggs were and how many were of each sex.  Then we make the decision and I get taken into the room for the transfer.Doc said there were plenty of eggs and the sperm count was extremely high.  The scary part is the transfer and the embryo attaching.  I know sooooooooo many on here have been through this and know what I mean.  I don't want to get my hopes up, but I also do not want to down play it and take the excitement away.  Just don't know how to feel right now.I am gaining weight on all of the meds that I am so distraught over that and I am not even pregnant.    Stink!!!!Sarbear, PGD is 5k.  My meds were 5k and 15k for all of the procedures/sperm aspiration, dr. visits, ultrasounds.....were 25k.  This round they gave me for 15k, so geeeeeeee what a break eh?  My meds were much less using a donor so that helped.Will let you know the breakdown when I get the results tomorrow.  Very nervous, what if very few fertilized?  I am so scared to have spent all of that for nothing as an end result.

Don't be to worried!  There are a lot of ladies that have been succesful with fets! Schroderheather has a son from frozen, jessting is preggo with twin boys, beanandsprout is preggo with twins, and I know there are others I am forgetting... Don't let that bother you, ok?  I will also be doing a fet, so we will both have faith, alright?   I actually got pregnant from a fet, but I m/c'd.

How exciting!  I hope you end up with lots of healthy embryos :).   It's cool that you got to speak to the donors bf.  That was awesome!  I understand 100% you thoughts on the implantation that part is out of our hands. I did a donor route with a known donor 2hers ago. We were successful on the first transfer, but I m/c'd.  We then found out that the re didn't retrieve the eggs as soon as he should have, then he froze them on day2, and then we pretty much had poor quality embryos that didn't work....long story.  We are now using donor embryos that someone on this site donated to us.  We have 10 very high quality embryos, and are very hopeful that they will be successful for us.   I'm sure you'll have some girls in there! Then you can freeze the boys for use later :). Let us know tomorrow what happens ok?? I will be watching for your update!

That is so awesome that someone donated their embryos.  I am so confused about that part.  I searched online for embryos and all I could find out and all of the places I called, was that you had to adopt them.  It would have been a lot less for me if I could have figured that out or had that option.I wonder if I could donate mine if everything goes well and I don't need them?  Only problem is I have donor eggs, so would I have to get permission from the donor?This whole thing is confusing and a lot of pieces to the puzzle.When will you do the transfer?  Do you currently have children?  Your one round really sounds like a mess and the Dr. didn't do the right things, so sorry for that.  It is hard enough what we go through, but to have that happen and out of your hands is wrong.  I hope he did something for you or gave you your money back.

Hey ladies,I was told something yesterday that I feel I have to share.  I know we all look for reasons why things didn't work out or go our way and what could we have done different or have added........While in the recovery room yesterday, my husband asks the nurse when we could have sex.  I hit him and said "honey, why in the world would you ask her that".  He said "well I think it's a great question".  Anyway the nurse said 2 weeks.  He was like are you kidding me and I was like, there are more things on my mind than worried about when I can have sex.SOOOOO, she explained that research has been done, and it is best that the uterus does not contract a week or a couple of weeks before transfer.  She said that it helps to have a calm uterus and free of tightening......which helps the embryo attach.  I said that I was willing to do anything I heard to help the embryo attach better.  So, there you have it ladies, tell those men to leave you alone while you are in the most important time of this whole thing.JUST a bit of info.

Well as you will tell reading here, costs vary a lot.I am in A2 Michigan and I paid my clinic 20k for my first IVF round using my own eggs and sperm aspiration for my husband.  Then the meds were about 5k.  There is a place to get your meds overseas that costs about half.  It is IVFMEDS.COM and I got my first round from them and then the 2nd time I only needed the Depot Lupron shot and got it from them too.  The depot was $900 here, but $400 from them.  You could check that out.My second round was using a donor for eggs, so that round I am paying 15k plus meds.  So this will be it for me, I am completely tapped financially.Hope that helps.

There are alot of clinics that have donor embryo programs. You just have to call clinics and see if they do.  They are much cheaper then "adopting" embryos.  When someone "donates" their embryos, there is much less paper work,and alot less legal stuff.    Donor embryos are definately much much,much cheaper! (it has cost us under $3,000 for legal fees and transfering them to OH, and storage at the clinic here).Once a female donates eggs, they have relequished any rights to them, so you do not need anything from the donor... they do have to have blood work done before, and after, but I am almost positive that is FDA standards anyway.  You could ask your clinic about that.  I can tell you from one very grateful person... donating your embryos is a wonderful wonderful thing!!!!My hubby and I do not have children.  We have been trying for about 8 years now, but only 2 yrs w/ RE's.  We were "older" when we got married, and are going to be anchient by the time they arrive! haha! : )Our embryos were in TX, and we had them transported to OH.No, our RE did nothing to compensate us... he just "wished me luck" as I hung up the phone with him the last time, when he refused to thaw our embryos and see if they could get to day 5.  It was a hard lesson learned on our part for sure!We were going to do a 100% percent $ back shared risk program with donor eggs before our lovely angel donated her embryos to us.We are fortunate enough to have fertility coverage right now, so our transfer is covered.  That has been a blessing!  We have 10 day 5blast embryos (all high quality).  The person that donated to us, has twins.  She got pregnant on the first round.Well, let us know how it goes today!!!!!!!!!  Fingers and toes are crossed!!!! : )

OMG, I am sooooooo upset right now.  They just called and said we got 7 eggs (keep in mind I share with another lady) and of my 7, 6 fertilized.  I'm sorry, I picked a 23 yr old in the hopes to have many eggs.  So my question is they allow these ladies to do up to 6 rounds of donating their eggs.  She did her first round last month, both ladies got pregnant.  One with twins and a single.  BUT back to my question, does this affect her on how many they produce when they do this month after month?  I can't imagine she only got 14 or 15 eggs.  C'mon, I am 42 and they got 12 from me.I just yelled at the lady and said with all I spent, how in the world does she think 6 eggs are a good number for me.  I get we can not predict, but I feel something isn't right.Now my odds have dramatically reduced.  I really was expecting about 12 at the least to work with.  Now I have 6, they will do the PGD and genetic testing, and what are my chances of all 6 being good quality and then what are my chances of having 2 of the females?Sorry, I just am so angry at the numbers.

I am so sorry you are upset. But, try and just remember... quality over quantity.  They retreived 18 from my first donor... but should have retreived sooner... You want the Best quality embryos possible.  You do not want to end up with crappy, useless embryos and have 10 or 15 of them.   I think the most I have seen on here with high quality embryos and young donors is KristyinGeorgia.  She had 20 embryos, and has twins, and 18 are frozen (these are her own eggs).  But, again that is unusual.I know some ladies on here have only had 2 or 3 embryos from their donors, and they are pregnant now... actually Marianna101 only had 2 embryos from her donor.  She is pregnant with twins.With my donated embryos, their were 12 to start with.  The donors were 26 and 27.  But, again, all 12 were high quality embryos,and there are 10 left.  So, don't get down just yet!I can understand your concern about the girls.  It does reduce your chances, but lets have faith that there will be 2 or maybe even 3... How long do you have to wait until you know?I will be thinking about you!  And praying for girls!!!

Now I just called the clinic back and left a long message.  I asked how her last cycle went and they told me about both ladies being pregnant.  Then I asked how many eggs did they retrieve and they said they can't share that number.  Hmmmmmmmmmmmmm that leads me to believe that there numbers probably go down each time OR my contract says that they consider 12 eggs from a donor good and each will get 6.  So would they use a third person and cheat us?  I mean really, 15 eggs total from a 23 year old who was on meds to produce eggs?  No way, I am not buying it at all.I am so angry I feel like calling the office over and over until I get someone.  I just do not think something is right.

Yeah, I used the crinone on my last transfer... it wasn't bad, but boy, that build up was different! : )   I would much rather be taking the progesterone pills (inserted vaginally) but, no such luck.  I just hope and pray I can get up the nerve to give myself my the shots on the weekend! ugh!  I did have a nurse agree to give them to me here at work during the week... so that make me feel much better.... Oh, how I HATE Needles!!!!! Ugh!

I am sorry to hear that you received bad news - however its not necessarily bad.  Out of the 21 retrieved from me only 3 were actually good quality.I am sure that if this girl is a regular donor she produces high quality eggs - that is better than throwing 18 away like I did.It will all work - I know that it is extremely frustrating.I have my transfer this Thursday at 7:30 am.  I cannot wait.On my way to acupuncture - smiles and hugs!!!!

Tell me about eating pineapple core 5 days after transfer.  What is that supposed to do?

You are suppose to buy a whole pineapple and cut it into 5 sections.  Then starting on the day of your transfer, you are suppose to eat 1 section of the pineapple core only ,a day, for 5 days.Here is some info I found:For IVF [in vitro fertilization] cycle: one pineapple core, divided into 5 portions - consume one portion each day, over five days, beginning on the day of your embryo transfer.IUI [intra-uterine insemination] cycle: one pineapple core, divided into 5 portions - consume one portion each day, over five days, beginning on the day of your IUI.Timed intercourse cycle: one pineapple core , divided into 5 portions - consume one portion each day, over five days, beginning on the day afterPineapple contains bromelain. Bromelain is a proteolytic enzyme that breaks up proteins that inhibit embryo implantation. Consuming a whole pineapple (focusing on the core as it has the highest concentration of Bromelain) during a fertility cycle can be beneficial.*****Note: Be careful not to start consuming pineapple core too early in the cycle. Beginning to consume pineapple core BEFORE the recommended days above can actually affect your vaginal and cervical mucus PH, making it more acidic.

I knew your husband would cave and let them put in the boy!!!  I just knew it!!!  Yay!  A boy and girl for you!!!!Well, all clinics grade different.They usually start with the highest being 5AA or 1AA. and go down from there.Like with us, the clinic that our embryos were created at, graded from grade from 5AA and the lowest being 1AB.We have :4 embryos are 5AB4 embryos are 3AA2 embryos are 3ABIt sounds like your clinic grades the same.  So, as you can see, you have 2 very high quality embryos!!!!It sounds like your boy was already starting to hatch.  (Just think of a chick coming out of the egg)... That is awesome!I am not sure what he means by the boy could push the girl out of the way, but it sounds like he thinks it will help her attach in some way???Here is a chart of what is going on:  (AS YOU WILL SEE YOUR BOY IS AHEAD OF SCHEDULE):5-DAY TRANSFER:-1dpt ..embryo is growing and developing0dpt... Embryo is now a blastocyst    - TRANSFER DAY -1dpt....Blastocyst hatches out of shell on this day2dpt.. Blastocyst attaches to a site on the uterine lining3dpt.. Implantation begins,as the blastocyst begins to bury in the lining4dpt.. Implantation process continues and morula buries deeper in the lining5dpt.. Morula is completely inmplanted in the lining and has placenta cells & fetal cells6dpt...Placenta cells begin to secret HCG in the blood7dpt...More HCG is produced as fetus develops8dpt...More HCG is produced as fetus develops9dpt...HCG levels are now high enough to be immediately detected on HPTGood to know about the staying out of the heat/sun part!  My RE never mentioned that!  I, too, like the sun, so That is great to know!!!!CONGRATS ON YOUR TRANSFER!!  GROW BABIES GROW~~

Alot of RE's do natural cycles, and do not put their patients on bcp/or lupron.  They call it a natural cycle.  My old RE did those.  It was when I first started the fertility journey.  I didn't understand either.  But, what they are doing is trying to "catch" your normal ovulation cycle.  That way, your body will be "expecting" the embryo, if that makes sense?  The estrace can delay but not prevent your ovulation.  They are probably checking your bloodwork alot to make sure you haven't ovulated correct? You lining will thicken on it's own just like it normally would every month on its own... and that's what the estrace is for also... to help the lining thickness. This gives them a certain window to work with, and if things don't look picture perfect, they may decide to delay transfer until next month.  But, if you don't usually have an issue with your lining, this most likely won't happen.Other RE's like to have a "controlled" enviroment.  They like to have control over the cycle, and mimic ovulation.  They want to make sure everything is "perfect" before transfer, ie: lining thickness.  That's why the lupron.  They shut down your ovaries so there is no chance of ovulation.  They want to create their own cycle.  It gives them more flexibility on the transfer date and the conditions of transfer (ie again lining.)Anyway, Good News!  I did get pregnant on my first natural cycle fet.. but unfortunately m/c'd, so they do work!!!  : )

No spicy foods (herbs)2. No caffeine3. No dark sodas4. No picante (hot sauce) of any kind5. No chocolate6. No cinnamonBasically nothing that will irritate the uterus.  As you can see ladies a bit different from the instructions you get here.Good luck to everyone!

I've not missed those so much.  I was wearing them from mid May to the beginning of July.  Off of them for a week and then back on them for 3 weeks.  Oh well, this time it's all going to be worth it.

Here's a cheat sheet for everyo who wants to test early  : )5-DAY TRANSFER:-1dpt ..embryo is growing and developing0dpt... Embryo is now a blastocyst1dpt....Blastocyst hatches out of shell on this day2dpt.. Blastocyst attaches to a site on the uterine lining3dpt.. Implantation begins,as the blastocyst begins to bury in the lining4dpt.. Implantation process continues and morula buries deeper in the lining5dpt.. Morula is completely inmplanted in the lining and has placenta cells & fetal cells6dpt...Placenta cells begin to secret HCG in the blood7dpt...More HCG is produced as fetus develops8dpt...More HCG is produced as fetus develops9dpt...HCG levels are now high enough to be immediately detected on HPT3-DAY TRANSFER:1dpt ..embryo is growing and developing2dpt... Embryo is now a blastocyst3dpt....Blastocyst hatches out of shell on this day4dpt.. Blastocyst attaches to a site on the uterine lining5dpt.. Implantation begins,as the blastocyst begins to bury in the lining6dpt.. Implantation process continues and morula buries deeper in the lining7dpt.. Morula is completely inmplanted in the lining and has placenta cells &fetal cells8dpt...Placenta cells begin to secret HCG in the blood9dpt...More HCG is produced as fetus develops10dpt...More HCG is produced as fetus develops11dpt...HCG levels are now high enough to be immediately detected onHPT

IHeartforababy-            8/3    IUI    Beta ??Nicole754-                   8/4   FET  Beta 8/15   1 embryoLadydi03-                    8/5   IVF   Beta 8/15    2 embryosSarbear11-                  Sept  TransferMustangSally-             8/17  FETHopeful4aBlessing-      9/12   FETMyYuyin2005-             8/21 or 8/23 IVFRisa615-                     8/15 or 8/16 IVFKimmiecle-                  8/11 SurgeryTrusting77-                  8/15 FETrghkah38-                    Starting 8/24MHV                           8/30 FETthinkingpositiveCA        2ww        Beta?Kris71                         Sept FETHopeful1703                 8/30 FETPinktootie                    8/28 FETBabyhope40527            8/26 IVFRedhead68                  Aug FETThings we have been told do or to avoid during the 2ww:+1-2 days bedrest,+Do not increase body temp.~Stay out of the heat, No Baths, No Hot Showers+No sex until beta~ some say until heartbeat is detected+No lifting over 25lbs, until negative test, or until RE says if positive.+No spicy foods (herbs)+ No caffeine+ No dark sodas+ No picante (hot sauce) of any kind+ No chocolate+ No cinnamon

My RE recommends:-bedrest day of ET and taking it easy the next day if able-No lifting any more than 10lbs until beta (12 days post transfer)-Sex is allowed (shockingly because everything else I read says not to, she claims sex is good and can help with implantation)-Drinks plenty of liquids to stay hydrated-Light exercise; walking is great-Plenty of sleep-Keep stress to a minimum-Heatlhy diet; low sodium, plenty of fresh fruits and veggies, lean meats-Drink 100% juice daily to help avoid constipation issues-No baths, swimming, or hot tubsI know there are more at home but those are the ones I remember off the top of my head- will report more later when I'm home. ;)BFP's all Aug & Sept long!!! :)
